forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. Southwest wind 5 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 6 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock ticks past 11 this winter night in Downtown San Francisco, the city wears a shroud of misty gray, cloaked in clouds that carry the promise of rain. A warm breeze whispers through the streets, stirring the already dampened air. The atmosphere feels alive, charged with the anticipation of the gathering storm, as the temperature hovers just above a delicate chill. A gentle sweep of clouds blankets the skyline, resting heavily upon the peaks of Sutro Tower, and faintly obscured lights flicker like stars lost to the fog. 

Tomorrow, the scenery will be no less dramatic, as the forecast unfolds a day drenched in possibility—rain will likely fall, dropping temperatures just as the winds pick up vigor. It will be a good idea to layer up; a weathered waterproof jacket paired with a cozy sweater will serve one well, allowing for a wander through the city’s robust landscape while staying shielded from the moisture creeping in. This type of day invites contemplation and a touch of introspection; perhaps take a stroll along the Embarcadero with a warm beverage in hand, allowing the soft patter of rain to soothe one's thoughts, or settle into a snug café, watching the world outside blur through the misty curtain of falling droplets, finding comfort in the simple rhythms of life amidst the city's elegant chaos.
